September 25, 2013 by Jon Cram

Our 58th updates newsletter went out today.

Highlights from this week:

  • Test history plans still underway

  • Start test form, test progress and test results pages are being simplified

  • New test types planned

Expect the next newsletter a week from now on October 2.

Simply Testable Updates #56: JSLint Config Options Released, JSLint Bug Fixes

September 11, 2013 by Jon Cram

Our 56th updates newsletter went out today.

Highlights from this week:

  • JSLint config options released

  • JSLint "unexpected control character" bug fixed

  • JSLint out of memory issues handled gracefully

Expect the next newsletter a week from now on September 18.

About Simply Testable

Simple, automated front-end web testing. One-click testing for your entire site.

Simply Testable does for front-end web testing what Github does for code and Travis CI does for code testing.

Learn more

Get updates

Get advanced invites to beta access and updates on new features.

You won't get inundated, we'll send updates about once a week and you can unsubscribe at any time if this bothers you.
